de.toman.milight

Class LightState

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.toman.milight.LightState

  • public class LightState
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LightState(MilightColor color, float brightness, boolean whiteMode, boolean on)
      This constructor creates a new LightState instance which stores the state of a group of lights.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(LightState state)
      This function checks whether two LightStates represent the same state.
      float getBrightness()
      This function returns the brightness level between 0 and 1 currently displayed by the group of lights if they are in white mode.
      MilightColor getColor()
      This function returns the color which is currently display by the group of lights if the lights are in colored mode.
      boolean isOn()
      This function returns whether the group of lights is switched on.
      boolean isWhiteMode()
      This function returns whether the group of lights is in white mode.
      void restore(Lights lights)
      This function restores the state represented by this instance to a group of lights.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This function describes the objet as a string.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightState

        public LightState(MilightColor color,
                  float brightness,
                  boolean whiteMode,
                  boolean on)
        This constructor creates a new LightState instance which stores the state of a group of lights.
        Parameters:
        color - is the color last displayed in colored mode
        brightness - is the brightness value last displayed in white mode (between 0 and 1)
        whiteMode - is true if the lights are currently in white mode and false if they are in colored mode
        on - is true if the group of lights is switched on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the brightness value is not between 0 and 1

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public MilightColor getColor()
        This function returns the color which is currently display by the group of lights if the lights are in colored mode. Otherwise, this is the color used last when the colored mode was activated
        Returns:
        the color displayed by the lights
        See Also:
        isWhiteMode()

      • isWhiteMode

        public boolean isWhiteMode()
        This function returns whether the group of lights is in white mode.
        Returns:
        true if the group of lights is in white mode, false if it uses the colored mode

      • getBrightness

        public float getBrightness()
        This function returns the brightness level between 0 and 1 currently displayed by the group of lights if they are in white mode. Otherwise, it is the brightness level used last when the lights were in white mode.
        Returns:
        the brightness level between 0 and 1
        See Also:
        isWhiteMode()

      • isOn

        public boolean isOn()
        This function returns whether the group of lights is switched on.
        Returns:
        true if the group of lights is switched on

      • equals

        public boolean equals(LightState state)
        This function checks whether two LightStates represent the same state.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to compare to
        Returns:
        true if both LightStates represent the same state, false otherwise

      • restore

        public void restore(Lights lights)
             throws java.io.IOException
        This function restores the state represented by this instance to a group of lights. Depending on the state, the group of lights is switched to colored resp. white mode and brightness/hue are adjusted.
        Parameters:
        lights - is the group of lights to be adjusted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message could not be sent

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This function describes the objet as a string. Use this for debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
